headings: Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
What Can You Do With an English Degree?
Why Earn My English Master’s Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Our fully online program offers eight-week courses taught by expert faculty. Whether you’re interested in literature, advanced writing and communication skills, or a deeper understanding of the human condition, our M.A. in English program will allow you to gain valuable skills and advance your career.

Our program consists of 36 credit hours (12 courses) and a comprehensive exam. Our small, asynchronous courses permit ample one-on-one engagement between students and faculty. They are also designed for maximum flexibility, allowing you to complete your degree at your own pace.

Our faculty are dedicated to your success. They are award-winning teachers and actively publishing scholars in their fields, which include British and American literature, technical writing, rhetoric and composition, writing pedagogy, and more.
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.

Earning your M.A. in English will prepare you for careers in higher education, high school teaching, nonprofit organizations, technology companies, publishing and marketing firms, politics, linguistics, sales, research, advising, human resources, and other fields. It can also prepare you to advance to a Ph.D. program or law school.

Our graduates are employed as full-time instructors at colleges and universities, dual-credit and AP teachers in high schools, and in a wide variety of industries with roles that require advanced research, writing and critical-thinking skills.

We offer multiple paid graduate assistantship positions each semester, which can significantly offset the cost of completing your degree. On-campus students can apply for paid graduate assistant (GA) or teaching assistant (TA) positions to work as tutors in ourWriting Centeror as instructors of first-year composition courses.
Work with faculty mentors onfunded independent study projectsin our close-knit and dynamic department community. We also offer several scholarships specifically for students in our department.

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

“I had no idea what I was getting myself into when I began my master’s degree at ASU, but the classes and the professors equipped me for even greater challenges.”

Lydia Nixon, English M.A. Program

“The English faculty at ASU are both brilliant and down to earth. The graduate classes are rigorous, but the professors make the material engaging and accessible.”

Lydia Nixon, Class of 2020, English M.A. Program
